bug.author: larroy
bug.description:
<denchmark-link:http://jenkins.mxnet-ci.amazon-ml.com/blue/organizations/jenkins/restricted-website-build/detail/restricted-website-build/957/pipeline>http://jenkins.mxnet-ci.amazon-ml.com/blue/organizations/jenkins/restricted-website-build/detail/restricted-website-build/957/pipeline</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:http://jenkins.mxnet-ci.amazon-ml.com/blue/organizations/jenkins/mxnet-validation%2Fwebsite/detail/PR-13818/6/pipeline>http://jenkins.mxnet-ci.amazon-ml.com/blue/organizations/jenkins/mxnet-validation%2Fwebsite/detail/PR-13818/6/pipeline</denchmark-link>
It's failing intermittently on PRs with oserror bad address from python.

comments.comment: Hey, this is the MXNet Label Bot. Thank you for submitting the issue! I will try and suggest some labels so that the appropriate MXNet community members can help resolve it. Here are my recommended labels: Bug, Flaky
Maybe this is the old version bug. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/5914>Sphinx-issue5914</denchmark-link>

Can we disable this until it's fixed? It's failing the majority of the builds <denchmark-link:https://github.com/apache/incubator-mxnet/commits/master>https://github.com/apache/incubator-mxnet/commits/master</denchmark-link>

I have tried, but the status is not being reported: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/apache/incubator-mxnet/pull/13841>#13841</denchmark-link>
I expected it to report success. Other than that this change should disable it.

Hanging of status result on successful builds was something I reported quite a while ago... you just need to restart that job and maybe it'll go through. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/apache/incubator-mxnet/issues/13714>#13714</denchmark-link>
I don't think anyone has looked at the underlying problem yet as there were no responses to the issue.
And this is a duplicate of <denchmark-link:https://github.com/apache/incubator-mxnet/issues/13831>#13831</denchmark-link>
